context:
| 2019 | 2018 | $ CHANGE | % CHANGE
--- | --- | --- | --- | ---
Bell Wireless | (5,300) | (5,297) | (3) | (0.1%)
Bell Wireline | (6,942) | (6,946) | 4 | 0.1%
Bell Media | (2,367) | (2,428) | 61 | 2.5%
Inter-segment eliminations | 751 | 738 | 13 | 1.8%
Total BCE operating costs | (13,858) | (13,933) | 75 | 0.5%

paragraph 1: 4.4 Operating costs
paragraph 2: Cost of revenues includes costs of wireless devices and other equipment sold, network and content costs, and payments to other carriers.
paragraph 3: Labour costs (net of capitalized costs) include wages, salaries and related taxes and benefits, post-employment benefit plans service cost, and other labour costs, including contractor and outsourcing costs
paragraph 4: Other operating costs include marketing, advertising and sales commission costs, bad debt expense, taxes other than income taxes, IT costs, professional service fees and rent
paragraph 5: BCE Total BCE operating costs declined by 0.5% in 2019, compared to last year, driven by reduced costs in Bell Media of 2.5%, while costs in Bell Wireless and Bell Wireline remained relatively stable year over year. These results reflected the benefit from the adoption of IFRS 16 in 2019.

qa.question: What does the cost of revenues include?
qa.answer: ['Cost of revenues includes costs of wireless devices and other equipment sold, network and content costs, and payments to other carriers.']
